itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Sydney Arthur "Syd"/"Sid" Williams (17 April 1918 – 28 August 1976) was a Welsh dual-code international rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Aberavon RFC, as a wing, i.e. number 11 or 14, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Wales, and at club level for Salford, as a fullback, wing, or centre, i.e. number, 1, 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4. He also appeared for Wigan (Heritage № 441) and Oldham RLFC (Heritage № 380) as a World War II guest player.
